title: Electronics Recycling and Delivery Service
content: A tech company operates multiple regional warehouses (`<loc_depot>`) to deliver new electronics to customers and collect old devices for recycling. Each truck (`<capacity> kg`) must first deliver new gadgets to linehaul customers before returning to pick up discarded devices from backhaul locations. Customers require specific delivery/pickup windows (`<time_windows>`) to align with office hours, and drivers must complete routes within an `<hour_limit>`-hour shift. The challenge is to balance depot assignments, avoid overloading vehicles with both new and old items, and ensure timely service without exceeding duration limits.

title: Meal Kit Delivery and Container Collection
content: A meal kit service uses `<loc_depot>` distribution centers to deliver fresh ingredients to households and collect reusable containers afterward. Trucks (`<capacity>` meals) must first drop off perishable kits (linehaul) before returning to pick up empty containers (backhaul). Each delivery must occur by `<time_windows>` to ensure meal freshness, while pickups are scheduled after meal preparation. Routes must stay within a `<hour_limit>` shift duration to prevent spoilage and meet customer convenience demands.

title: Construction Material Supply and Equipment Pickup
content: Construction firms rely on `<loc_depot>` depots to deliver building materials (e.g., lumber, tools) to job sites and retrieve unused equipment afterward. Vehicles (`<capacity>` tons) must first complete deliveries to linehaul customers before backhauling returned gear. Sites have strict `<time_windows>` to match work schedules, and routes must finish within `<hour_limit>` hours to avoid delays. The goal is to optimize multi-depot assignments, prevent overloading trucks with mixed cargo, and synchronize with construction timelines.

title: Event Venue Setup and Teardown Logistics
content: A venue management company organizes `<loc_depot>` hubs to deliver staging equipment (e.g., tents, chairs) to event locations and collect them post-event. Linehaul deliveries must arrive by `<time_windows>` to ensure setup before events start, while backhaul pickups occur after `<time_windows>`. Each truck (`<capacity>` cubic meters) must handle both tasks without exceeding weight limits, and routes must be completed within `<hour_limit>` hours to accommodate tight event schedules.

title: Automotive Parts Distribution and Recycling
content: Automotive dealerships receive new parts (`<demand_linehaul>`) from `<loc_depot>` warehouses and return damaged or obsolete components (`<demand_backhaul>`). Trucks (`<capacity>` units) must first deliver parts to linehaul customers before picking up recyclables. Dealerships have strict `<time_windows>` for part installation timelines, and routes must stay within `<hour_limit>` durations to meet service agreements. The challenge includes balancing multi-depot workflows, adhering to capacity limits for mixed cargo, and minimizing idle time during pickups.

title: Agricultural Supply Delivery and Harvest Collection
content: A farming cooperative uses multiple regional depots (<loc_depot>) to supply farmers with seeds, fertilizers, and equipment while collecting harvested crops. Each truck (<capacity> ton capacity) must first deliver supplies to farms (<loc_customer>), then return to the same depot after picking up crops. Farms have specific service windows (<time_windows>) when labor is available, and drivers cannot exceed an 8-hour workday (<duration>). The challenge is to balance route lengths, ensure capacity isn’t exceeded during deliveries *and* pickups, and respect the sequence of deliveries before harvest collection.

title: Medical Supply Redistribution and Waste Collection
content: A healthcare logistics firm operates from three central depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver medical supplies (<demand_linehaul>) to rural clinics and collect biohazard waste (<demand_backhaul>). Each vehicle (<capacity> kg capacity) must prioritize deliveries before pickups, adhere to clinic operating hours (<time_windows>), and complete routes within a 6-hour window (<duration>). The clinics require urgent supplies but cannot store waste overnight, making tight scheduling critical to prevent overloading trucks or violating regulatory timelines.

title: E-commerce Returns and Fresh Delivery Consolidation
content: An online retailer with five distribution hubs (<loc_depot>) must deliver new packages (<demand_linehaul>) to customers while collecting returned items (<demand_backhaul>). The complexity arises from optimizing return pickups without overfilling trucks, especially as bulky items may reduce space for outbound deliveries.

content: A city’s waste management team deploys trucks from three depots (<loc_depot>) to deliver empty recycling bins (<demand_linehaul>) to residential areas and retrieve filled ones (<demand_backhaul>). title: Live Event Catering and Equipment Recollection
content: A catering company with four regional kitchens (<loc_depot>) delivers meals and equipment (<demand_linehaul>) to event venues, then collects used items (<demand_backhaul>). title: Regional Furniture Delivery and Disposal Service
content: A furniture retailer operates from multiple regional warehouses (depots) and serves customers across urban and rural areas. The challenge is to balance workload across depots, respect time windows, avoid overloading, and minimize total distance while ensuring compliance with driver fatigue regulations.

title: Car Rental Kiosk Resupply and Vehicle Return Management
content: A car rental service deploys `<loc_depot>` hubs to replenish rental vehicles at kiosk locations (`<loc_customer>`) and collect returned cars. title: Livestock Feed Distribution and Manure Collection
content: A farming cooperative operates multiple regional depots to supply feed to cattle farms and collect manure for composting. Each truck has a capacity limit for combined feed and manure loads. Deliveries of feed must occur during morning time windows when farmers are available, while manure pickups are scheduled in the afternoon. Routes must ensure drivers adhere to 8-hour shift limits, balancing the sequence of deliveries (linehaul) followed by pickups (backhaul) without exceeding capacity or time constraints.

title: Urban Grocery Delivery and Organic Waste Retrieval
content: A city-based grocery chain uses decentralized distribution centers to deliver perishables to residential areas and collect organic waste from customers. Each vehicle’s capacity must accommodate both fresh produce and waste bins, with routes planned to avoid exceeding 6-hour operational limits. title: Corporate Event Equipment Deployment and Retrieval
content: A rental company provides temporary equipment for corporate events, deploying projectors, AV systems, and furniture from regional warehouses. Backhauls of returned gear must follow linehaul deliveries, with trucks respecting 10-hour route duration limits to meet next-day event commitments. title: Rental Vehicle Delivery and Return Logistics
content: An auto rental firm operates from multiple city hubs to deliver cars to customer locations and collect returned vehicles. Each truck’s capacity accommodates both outbound rentals (linehaul) and inbound returns (backhaul), ensuring routes finish within 12-hour limits to comply with driver rest regulations. title: Medical Supply Delivery and Blood Sample Collection
content: A healthcare logistics provider distributes vaccines and medical kits to clinics while collecting blood samples for lab analysis. title: Organic Waste Collection and Biogas Delivery Network

content: A film logistics provider coordinates equipment deployment for movie sets using multiple regional warehouses.
